title: 2024 World AeroPress Champion - George Stanica (Romania) - Inverted
preparation_steps: Rinse one Aesir paper filter with hot water and fit it in the cap (removes papery taste).
Assemble the AeroPress in inverted position and align it approx. to the 4th mark.
Weigh 18 g of coffee and grind to medium-coarse (Comandante C40 Mk4, ~58 clicks / ~870 µm).
Add the 18 g ground coffee to the inverted AeroPress and give a gentle shake to level the bed.
Prepare extraction water (96 °C) and a Melodrip (or similar) for controlled pours. Have scale and timer ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 50 g of 96 °C water using the Melodrip (aim 5–6 s for the pour). Allow the coffee to bloom: wait ~30 s (bloom period ends ~00:35).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 35 seconds, you should have finished the bloom. Start your timer and pour 50 grams of 96 degrees Celsius water using the Melodrip. Aim for about 5 to 6 seconds for the pour. Allow the coffee to bloom and wait about 30 seconds - the bloom period ends at 35 seconds.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour the second 50 g of 96 °C water (again ~5–6 s pour).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 6 seconds, you should have poured the second water. Now pour the second 50 grams of 96 degrees Celsius water. Again, aim for about 5 to 6 seconds for this pour to maintain consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stir gently in a North–South–East–West (NSEW) pattern for ~10 s to homogenize.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have finished stirring. Now stir gently in a North-South-East-West pattern for about 10 seconds to homogenize the coffee slurry. This ensures even extraction and proper mixing of the grounds.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 1:05 (≈65 s) screw on the rinsed cap and gently press to remove excess air (~10 s).
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Screw on cap • Press out air
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 14 seconds, you should have the cap on and air pressed out. At 1:05, screw on the rinsed cap and gently press to remove excess air. This should take about 10 seconds and helps create a proper seal.

brewing_steps.instruction: Give a gentle swirl to the AeroPress, place it onto your serving vessel, and begin the slow, controlled press. Aim to finish pressing within 30–40 s. Target yield: ~76–79 g of concentrate.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Swirl gently • Place on vessel • Press 30-40s
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 40 seconds to complete this step. Give a gentle swirl to the AeroPress, place it onto your serving vessel, and begin the slow, controlled press. Aim to finish pressing within 30 to 40 seconds. Your target yield should be about 76 to 79 grams of concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction: When press is complete, add warm water until total weight reaches 130–135 g (bypass step).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 20 seconds, you should have added the warm water. When the press is complete, add warm water until the total weight reaches 130 to 135 grams. This is the bypass step that dilutes the concentrate to your desired strength.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add an additional 20–30 g of room-temperature 0 ppm water for balance (final total ≈150–165 g depending on target).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished adding water. Add an additional 20 to 30 grams of room-temperature 0 parts per million water for balance. The final total should be about 150 to 165 grams depending on your target strength.

equipment: Comandante C40 Mk4 (or equivalent) for grind reference
notes: Recipe by George Stanica (World Champ 2024). Focus on precise water chemistry and two pours for controlled saturation. Bypass at two temperatures (hot water for strength and 0 ppm water at room temperature for balance and clarity). The medium-coarse grind and slow pressing seek clarity while avoiding over-extraction.

title: 2023 World AeroPress Champion - Tay Wipvasutt (Thailand) - Inverted
preparation_steps: Rinse and place a paper filter in the cap, if you prefer; assemble AeroPress inverted.
Weigh 18 g total: prepare 16 g to add initially and keep 2 g set aside for later addition.
Grind to the competition setting (1ZPresso ZP6, 65 clicks).
Heat Perfect Coffee Water to 89 °C. Prepare scale and timer.

brewing_steps.instruction: Place 16 g of grounds in the inverted AeroPress. Start timer and pour 100 g of 89 °C water over the grounds. Then stir for ~5 s to agitate and homogenize the slurry.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 30 seconds, you should have finished stirring. Place 16 grams of grounds in the inverted AeroPress. Start your timer and pour 100 grams of 89 degrees Celsius water over the grounds. Then stir for about 5 seconds to agitate and homogenize the slurry.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 0:45, add the remaining 2 g of coffee (late addition).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 15 seconds, you should have added the late coffee. At 0:45, add the remaining 2 grams of coffee. This late addition technique introduces fresh aromatic compounds without over-extracting the main body.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 0:55, stir again for ~5 s to incorporate the late addition.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have finished stirring. At 0:55, stir again for about 5 seconds to incorporate the late addition. This ensures the fresh coffee grounds are properly mixed into the slurry.

brewing_steps.instruction: Slightly press the plunger up to remove excess air, then securely close the cap.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have the cap closed. Slightly press the plunger up to remove excess air, then securely close the cap. This creates a proper seal for the steeping phase.

brewing_steps.instruction: Carefully flip the AeroPress and begin pressing at 1:40 (≈100 s). Press steadily for ~30 s. Target yield: ~75 g concentrate.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 30 seconds to complete this step. Carefully flip the AeroPress and begin pressing at 1:40. Press steadily for about 30 seconds. Your target yield should be about 75 grams of concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bypass the concentrate with room-temperature water until total weight reaches 115 g (first bypass).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 30 seconds, you should have finished the first bypass. Bypass the concentrate with room-temperature water until the total weight reaches 115 grams. This is the first bypass that controls strength and temperature.

brewing_steps.instruction: Then add hot water until total weight reaches 155 g (second bypass / final tempered).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished adding hot water. Then add hot water until the total weight reaches 155 grams. This is the second bypass for final tempering and achieving the desired strength.

notes: Technique by Tay Wipvasutt (World Champ 2023). Use of 'late addition' (2g added at 0:45) to introduce fresh aromatic compounds without over-extracting the main body. Bypass in two stages (room-temp and hot) to control strength and final temperature.

title: 2022 World AeroPress Champion - Jibbi Little (Australia) - Inverted

parameters.grind_size: Dual-grind then sifted (coarse via Timemore -> refined on Kinu #4); fines removed (100–200 µm)

preparation_steps: Prepare and sift grounds per method: coarse grind (Timemore) → refine on Kinu #4 → sift to remove fines (100–200 µm).
Rinse a paper filter and place in the cap; assemble AeroPress inverted.
Weigh 18.0 g of the prepared grounds and add them to the chamber.
Heat Perfect Coffee Water to 92 °C for extraction and prepare 90 °C water for bypass.

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 94 ml of 92 °C water evenly over the grounds. Then stir gently 35 times (steady, gentle strokes) to ensure full saturation—this will take ~30–40 s depending on pace.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 45 seconds to complete this step. Start your timer and pour 94 milliliters of 92 degrees Celsius water evenly over the grounds. Then stir gently 35 times using steady, gentle strokes to ensure full saturation. This will take about 30 to 40 seconds depending on your pace.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 1:20 (≈80 s) screw on the rinsed filter cap and press out any remaining air from the chamber.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Screw on cap • Press out air
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 40 seconds to complete this step. At 1:20, screw on the rinsed filter cap and press out any remaining air from the chamber. This creates a proper seal for the steeping phase.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 1:30 (≈90 s) flip the AeroPress carefully onto your server and begin pressing. Press steadily for ~30 s.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have flipped the AeroPress. At 1:30, flip the AeroPress carefully onto your server and begin pressing. Press steadily for about 30 seconds.

brewing_steps.instruction: Complete the press (target window between 1:40 and 2:10; typical yield ≈58–64 g concentrate).
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 30 seconds to complete the press. Complete the press within the target window between 1:40 and 2:10. Your typical yield should be about 58 to 64 grams of concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bypass the concentrate with 90 °C water until total weight reaches 150 g.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished adding bypass water. Bypass the concentrate with 90 degrees Celsius water until the total weight reaches 150 grams.

brewing_steps.instruction: Optional: add 4 chilled ice balls for smoother mouthfeel (ice-bypass technique) if serving cold or to rapidly lower temperature.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished adding ice. Optional: add 4 chilled ice balls for smoother mouthfeel using the ice-bypass technique. This is useful if serving cold or to rapidly lower the temperature.

equipment: Jar for dilutions / ice if applicable
notes: Advanced technique by Jibbi Little (World Champ 2022). Use of dual grinder and sieving for extreme control of particle distribution; many gentle revolutions for saturation (35 stirs) and bypass at 90°C up to 150g to achieve desired texture and temperature. Ideal for competitions and demonstrations of clarity and texture.

title: 2021 World AeroPress Champion - Tuomas Merikanto (Finland) - Inverted
preparation_steps: Weigh 18.0 g of coffee and grind on Macap Labo 70D at setting 7.0.
Assemble the AeroPress in inverted position and place on the scale.
Prepare Third Wave Water Formula 2 and heat to 80 °C.
Have pitcher and target server ready for the 'pour from altitude' stage.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add 18.0 g of grounds to the inverted AeroPress. Start timer and add 50 g of 80 °C water between 0:00–0:10 (gentle pour).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have poured the first water. Add 18.0 grams of grounds to the inverted AeroPress. Start your timer and add 50 grams of 80 degrees Celsius water between 0:00 and 0:10 using a gentle pour.

brewing_steps.instruction: From 0:10–0:15, stir very gently 3 times back and forth.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished stirring. From 0:10 to 0:15, stir very gently 3 times back and forth. This gentle agitation helps with initial extraction without over-agitating the coffee.

brewing_steps.instruction: From 0:15–0:30 continue pouring water gradually until total poured reaches 200 g (slow, controlled pour).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 15 seconds, you should have poured all the water. From 0:15 to 0:30, continue pouring water gradually until the total poured reaches 200 grams. Use a slow, controlled pour to maintain consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 0:50, stir very gently 3 more times to re-homogenize the bed.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 20 seconds, you should have finished stirring. At 0:50, stir very gently 3 more times to re-homogenize the coffee bed. This ensures even extraction throughout the brewing process.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 1:00 (≈60 s), push out any excess air from the chamber and attach the filter cap; allow brewing until ~1:40 (≈100 s).
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Press out air • Attach filter cap
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have the filter cap attached. At 1:00, push out any excess air from the chamber and attach the filter cap. Allow brewing until about 1:40, which is about 100 seconds total.

brewing_steps.instruction: At ~1:35 place your pitcher on top of the AeroPress; at 1:40 (≈100 s) flip the brewer carefully.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 40 seconds to complete this step. At about 1:35, place your pitcher on top of the AeroPress. At 1:40, flip the brewer carefully onto the pitcher.

brewing_steps.instruction: Immediately begin pressing from 1:40–2:00 (≈20 s press).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 20 seconds, you should have finished pressing. Immediately begin pressing from 1:40 to 2:00. This should take about 20 seconds of press time.

brewing_steps.instruction: From 2:00–2:30 (≈120–150 s) swirl the brewed coffee and perform a 'pour from altitude' into another pitcher to aerate and cool.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 30 seconds to complete this step. From 2:00 to 2:30, swirl the brewed coffee and perform a 'pour from altitude' into another pitcher to aerate and cool the coffee. This technique helps with aeration and temperature control.

equipment: Third Wave Water Formula 2 (or prepared mineral profile)
notes: Recipe by Tuomas Merikanto (World Champ 2021). Focus on water chemistry (TWW Formula 2), two pouring stages with a low extraction point (80°C) and manipulation techniques (very gentle stirs, quick flip and press) followed by 'pour from altitude' for aeration and cooling.
